Isn't it kind of general consensus that un-messaged invites and or invites from people you don't regularly play with are kind of just leisurely?

I mean if I am just throwing out invites to fill up a team or custom or whatever I don't give a shit if someone declines, just the same I don't expect people to care if I decline their random invite. Sometimes that's just what you do, spam available people on your list to fill spots, it's not like they have to be someone I que regularly with, isn't that the point of a friends list/folders in a friends list?

Edit: Maybe "spam" is the wrong word to use, but you get  my point.
Delete them, or make other acc
Or just (wo)man up and tell them that you don't want to play?  I don't understand why people can't just tell the truth these days...
or just dont be a dickhead and play with the fucker, if you dont ever intend on playing with them then unfriend them, problem solved
Not wanting to play right now does not equal never wanting to play with them. Some people DON'T WANT TO PLAY with everyone on their friend's list.

How hard is it to just tell them you don't want to play?
If it's some random person I met in a game and added I just tell them I want to play solo.

In my circle of irl friends we all just communicate and just tell each other when we want to play or not.

friends: hey wanna play an aram/duo/flex
me: not right now
friends: ok cool let us know if you want an invite later
and vice versa

as opposed to the following scenario:
friend: wanna duo?
friend: you there?
me: queues for solo queue/closes client

which do you think is going to make things more awkward?
even with friends who are lower ranked than me I just straight up tell them I'm not interested in playing ranked with them and they're fine with it

Just communicate people... and if people get upset with you for being honest and polite then fuck them, they're not worth your time.
